title: Dish and Dishonesty
desc: Blackadder enters politics in an attempt to avoid Pitt the Younger from striking the Prince off the Civil List.

title: Ink and Incapability
desc: Baldrick burns the only copy of Samuel Johnson's dictionary, and Blackadder has only one weekend to rewrite it.

title: Nob and Nobility
desc: Blackadder seeks to prove he's just as capable of rescuing people from France as The Scarlet Pimpernel.

title: Sense and Senility
desc: Following a failed assassination attempt, the Prince Regent hires two actors to tutor him in public speaking.

title: Amy and Amiability
desc: When Blackadder discovers that the Prince Regent is completely broke, he devises a plan to restore his fortunes through marriage.

title: Duel and Duality
desc: Blackadder's militant cousin McAdder arrives in London as the Prince Regent seduces some relatives of the fiery Duke of Wellington.
